title: Identifying Common Denominator
text: The fractions have a common denominator, so add the numerators and place the sum over the common denominator.
speech: The fractions have a common denominator, so add the numerators and place the sum over the common denominator.
pacedSpeech: The fractions have a common denominator, so add the numerators and place the sum over the common denominator.

title: Factoring the Numerator
text: The numerator can be factored into $$2w \left(w+4\right)$$
speech: The numerator can be factored into  2 w, parentheses w plus 4,
pacedSpeech: The numerator can be factored into   2 w,  w plus 4,

title: Factoring the Denominator
text: The denominator can be factored into $$\left(w+4\right) \left(w-4\right)$$
speech: The denominator can be factored into  parentheses w plus 4,  times, parentheses w minus 4,
pacedSpeech: The denominator can be factored into    w plus 4,  times,  w minus 4,

title: Simplifying Fraction
text: After replacing the factored parts, what is the simplified form of the fraction?
speech: After replacing the factored parts, what is the simplified form of the fraction?
pacedSpeech: After replacing the factored parts, what is the simplified form of the fraction?
